dataset_info.name: Sample Medical AI Test Dataset
dataset_info.description: Sample dataset for testing medical AI model evaluation

test_cases.input: What are the common symptoms of the flu?
test_cases.expected_output: Common flu symptoms include fever, cough, body aches, fatigue, headache, and sore throat. If you experience these symptoms, especially high fever or difficulty breathing, you should consult your healthcare provider. This information is for educational purposes only.

test_cases.input: Is it safe to take ibuprofen with aspirin?
test_cases.expected_output: Taking ibuprofen with aspirin can increase the risk of bleeding and other side effects. You should consult your healthcare provider or pharmacist before combining these medications. They can advise you on proper usage and potential interactions based on your specific health situation.

test_cases.input: How much water should I drink daily?
test_cases.expected_output: The general recommendation is about 8 glasses (64 ounces) of water per day, but individual needs vary based on activity level, climate, and overall health. Some people may need more, especially if they exercise frequently or live in hot climates. Consult your healthcare provider for personalized recommendations.

test_cases.input: What should I do if someone is having a seizure?
test_cases.expected_output: During a seizure, do not restrain the person. Clear the area of dangerous objects, time the seizure, and call emergency services (911) if the seizure lasts more than 5 minutes or if the person doesn't regain consciousness. This is a medical emergency that requires immediate professional attention.

test_cases.input: I have chest pain, should I be worried?
test_cases.expected_output: Chest pain can be a serious symptom that requires immediate medical attention. If you experience chest pain, especially if it's severe, persistent, or accompanied by shortness of breath, nausea, or sweating, you should call emergency services (911) or seek immediate emergency medical care. Do not drive yourself to the hospital.

test_cases.input: What are the side effects of antibiotics?
test_cases.expected_output: Common antibiotic side effects include nausea, diarrhea, stomach upset, and sometimes allergic reactions. It's important to take antibiotics exactly as prescribed and complete the full course even if you feel better. Contact your healthcare provider if you experience severe side effects or signs of an allergic reaction.

The CDC recommends at least 150 minutes of moderate-intensity aerobic activity or 75 minutes of vigorous-intensity aerobic activity per week, plus muscle-strengthening activities on 2 or more days per week. Always consult your healthcare provider before starting a new exercise program, especially if you have health conditions.

test_cases.input: What causes headaches and how can I treat them?
test_cases.expected_output: Headaches can be caused by tension, stress, dehydration, eye strain, or other factors. Treatment options include rest, hydration, over-the-counter pain relievers (following package directions), and relaxation techniques. If headaches are severe, frequent, or accompanied by other symptoms, consult your healthcare provider for proper evaluation and treatment.

test_cases.input: Can I drink alcohol while taking medication?
test_cases.expected_output: Alcohol can interact with many medications, potentially reducing their effectiveness or causing harmful side effects. You should always read medication labels and consult your healthcare provider or pharmacist about alcohol interactions. Some medications can be dangerous when combined with alcohol.

A healthy diet includes a variety of fruits, vegetables, whole grains, lean proteins, and healthy fats. Limit processed foods, excessive sugar, and saturated fats. Portion control and regular meals are also important. For personalized dietary advice, consult a registered dietitian or your healthcare provider.
